p.em: If you have not given the school your email, please email

ul.li: Per the State Department of Education, we are asking parents to call in or email if your son or daughter is sick on remote learning days and unable to engage in their schoolwork. This needs to be done only if your child is sick and not able to do school work.
If you have questions please email

hr.ul:
Today Governor Sununu announced that all schools will be doing remote learning until the end of the school year. We understand the anxiety that this will bring to you, your students, and the staff. We will continue with the Phase II plan at this time. We would like everyone next week just to relax and enjoy your families. Hopefully, it will be nice enough to work outside, we will all have the best-looking yards this year because we have the time!
Reminder we will all be on vacation next week, meals will be available Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 7:00 am to 11:00 am at the Hinsdale Middle High School and from 7:00 to 10:00 am at the Hinsdale Community Church, special thanks to our food warriors! If your circumstances change please let us know and we will be happy to provide meals, just come to one of the sites and your name will be added to the list.
We are still looking for masks for our food warriors, if anyone has some they can be dropped off in the lockbox.
Thank you to everyone for doing the best they can!! – Added 4/16/2020

We are going to address a safety concern for families and our staff and just a few updates.
Please stay in your car when you are picking up meals at the pickup sites. Please pop your trunk or storage and our staff will put in the meals. Please do not get out of your car, please do not expect staff to put the meals into a back seat where your children at seated, we are trying to keep everyone safe.
Hinsdale Elementary packet drop off is ending today Tuesday, April 14, you can drop at the lockbox located at the Hinsdale Middle High School.
Lunches will be available during vacation next week at Hinsdale Middle High School-Gym 7:00 am to 11:00 am and The North Hinsdale Community Church, from 7:00 am to 10:00 am, on Monday Wednesday and Friday.
The schools will be closed from April 20 to 25, all offices will be closed.
We will keep updating you on information concerning the rest of the school year as soon as we know and develop a plan moving forward.
As always if you have any questions please reach out to your child’s teachers or the school offices, Hinsdale Elementary School 336-5332, Hinsdale Middle High School 336-5984 and the District offices at 336-5728 ext. 7684, or via email at – Added 4/14/2020

ul.li: The Hinsdale School Board last night decided that the School District will still have an April vacation! So from April 20 to 25, you will have no school work to do, unless you want to. Take this time to make a few memories, we would love it if you send us your pictures, just email and we may share them on social media.

We will be having breakfast and lunch pick up during vacation on Monday, Wednesday and Friday at the Middle High School Gym from 7:00 am to 11:00 am and at the North Hinsdale Community Church from 7:00 am to 10:00 am.

The lockbox for dropping off your student’s work has been set up at the Hinsdale Middle High School right outside the main doors. This can be used for both schools if you are unable to drop off during school office hours which at this time is from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.
We have completed the report card process at HMHS and the grades are ready to view on PowerSchool for quarter 3, the Hinsdale Elementary School reports card will be in the mail this week.

We have added several documents to our COVID-19 website that you may find helpful. Please check this out we will be adding new information to this site as we receive things that we feel you may be interested in. Section E below has some new links.

Again, thank you for all you are doing and if you have any questions, problems, etc. please call the school, we are here to help, Hinsdale Elementary School 336-5332, Hinsdale Middle High School 336-5984 and the Hinsdale School District offices 336-5984 ext. 7684, and .

Be on the lookout for a group of teachers, and a few others that will be out and about tomorrow Friday, April 10, 2020, they will be going all over town trying to see as many of you as they can. You will hear them coming!
Stay safe, keep practicing social distancing no matter how hard it is, because it is working and we want to see you all soon! – Added 4/9/2020

As many of you may have heard Governor Sununu has extended remote learning through May 4th. We know you all will have many questions and we will answer them as soon as we can. We are all getting this information at the same time, staff and parents. Our staff will be working next week, to institute phase two of the remote learning plan. We will have another message to you as soon as that plan is complete. We do not anticipate that happening until later in the week. If you have any questions concerning your child’s current remote learning plan, please email your teacher. If you have any questions regarding any other issues please email . Thank you all for your patience, thank you for all you do.

April 8, 2020, is the date we will store quarter three grades and within a day or two, we will have final grades ready for quarter three for parents to view in PowerSchool for grades 6-12 and for the report cards to be printed for grades K-5. We will notify you via social media and our website when this process has been finalized. This schedule matches our schedule for grade distribution for quarter three.

With the closure of local libraries, there are still lots of ways for your children to continue reading. Please go to Mrs. Dow’s teacher website on the Hinsdale Elementary School webpage under the Parents Tab or to the Library Tab on the Middle/High School webpage for links to free audiobooks and read-alouds. Mrs. Dow’s webpage and HMHS Library school closure page
Reminder to all students and parents please refer to your teacher’s websites regularly for assignments and check your student emails for messages.
Please check your specials teachers they are teaching from their teacher websites, specials include PE, Music, Art, health, etc.

Please connect with classroom teachers frequently they are more than willing to help you with any problems that you are facing, we do ask though to be conscientious of their time, some are in the same situation as you are, helping their children with assignments etc. We ask you and your students to respect their” office hours” if they have provided them.

This is obviously a unique and possibly one and only time when we find ourselves with that extra time to be with our children. Read with them. Have them read to you. Tell stories that they could illustrate or draw a picture and have them tell the story.

Please, please if you are having problems contact the schools, we can only help if you reach out to us, we are all in this together and are here to help in any way we can. HES 336-5332, HMHS 336-5984, and HSD 336-5728 ext. 7684.

We understand that many of you are facing uncertain times, if you need meal assistance please let us know at the following email address or just come and see us at the Hinsdale Middle High School from 7:00 am to 11:00 am or the North Hinsdale Community Church from 7:15 am to 10:00 am on Monday, Wednesday, or Friday.
Meals Storage & Heating – Added 3/27/2020

We are still serving meals; we have some people that are on the list that we have not seen. If you have any food concerns please email them to and we will address them ASAP. Our teachers and support staff have been working to connect with our families, please email your child’s teacher if you have any concerns regarding remote learning. You can find teacher email addresses at the school websites under Parents then Staff email. Next week our support staff will be working to contact each student that we have not heard from, please expect their call, we need your communication to help us with our personalized learning approach. We would also like to thank you very much for your support, the emails, and thank yous to our staff have meant so much. We are a community and in this together. #Hinsdale Strong. – Added 3/25/2020

Please note we are trying to call people who have asked for meals and many of you have disconnected numbers, numbers that have been blocked, emails that can’t go through etc. Please email to update your information, in these times it is imperative that we have working phone numbers, emails etc. We will be doing very few text messages due to the limited amount of characters available. We have updated our meal pick up time, pick up at the North Hinsdale Community Church will be Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 7:00 am to 10:00 am and at the Hinsdale Middle High School pick up will be from 7:00 am to 11:00 am. If your situation changes and you find you need to have meals for your children please email . If you have any pictures of your children remote learning on your social media accounts remember to use #NHlearnsremotely and #Americalearnsremotely – Added 3/23/2020
Week in Review– Added 3/20/2020
The email address below is referenced in today’s call and in the Week in Review document above.
Remote Learning Pickup– Added 3/17/2020

p.strong: C. Hinsdale Elementary Schoool News and Updates

ul.li: 1. Daily activities from HASP will be available to students on HASP’s new web page (elementary school site) beginning Monday, April 6th.

2. HASP will also continue to provide homework support to middle school students through Teams in Office365, Monday through Thursday (2:45 pm to 4:00 pm). Any middle school student is welcome to join this team. Parents may check the email sent on Monday, March 23rd for details
regarding this opportunity for your children.

3. HES will have their own drop off for students’ work starting on April 6, 2020 hours will be 8:00 am to 2:00 pm, at HES. The lockbox for dropping off your student’s work has been set up at the Hinsdale Middle High School right outside the main doors if you are unable to drop off during the 8:00 am to 2:00 pm hours at HES.
